Be lets that hang there, then gives Jonnie a pointed look PARSON STAFFER (cont'd) But all it would take is for one monster to see you, and follow you back, and we would all be struck down. Jonnie meets his rage with calm determination.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE

dialogues.speaker: _ JONNIE
dialogues.text: . (finishing his thought) --I think you can handle yourself better than most men... Which is why you must stay and look after your younger brothers. Chrissy looks at him, chagrined. It's hard to argue with A tough beat. Nothing left but to say good-bye... And finally, struggling to keep her face a mask, Chrissy a shiny MEDALLION hanging from her neck.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISSY
dialogues.text: This was given to me by my father when he died. He received it from his father. (trying to hold back the emotions) I'm not giving it to you. I'm lending it. So, you better not let anything happen to you out there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . The young ones obediently stop at the bridge. They will She places the medallion around his neck, their bodies cl not touching. So much not being said... But Jonnie does, leaving the’tribe behind. Chrissy's mask starting +o crack as she watches him disap The first of the tears escaping down her cheeks. |

And now we can see that while this Psychlo is an imposing at nine feet tall, he's actually a bit of a runt. The oth Psychlos are all a good foot or two taller... Including the clerk, who takes one look at Jonnie and the and drills a hard stare into the undersized Psychlo "wran  a)

The wrangler pulls his PSYCHLO CLERK . Don't kill it! . We can't use it if it's’ dead-- . The wrangler gives him a snide, ‘How stupid do you think look. Hi lies motionless, but intact, on the ground. The Psychlo holsters his fire-arm and scoops up Jonnie. S to toss him back into the cage but-- ident li he! 1 i esi é hi Jonnie has the weapon. dialogues.text: Blown through his chest. He collapses, dead before he hit ground. The other Psychlos freeze in stunned silence. The Burst out in hysterical laughter. That has got to be the funniest thing they've ever seen. With the monsters busy laughing, Jonnie makes a break for Charging through the warehouse complex and out a doorway-

dialogues.text: Who unlike the Psychlo laborers, wears a senior officer's adorned with impressive gold epaulets, denoting "Chief of His ever present assistant, KER, can't help but snicker a collision has splattered over his boss's perfectly presse But Terl doesn't seem to find it amusing. He shuts Ker up quick look, then rips Jonnie off his feet--

And you're out of your skull if you think I'm going to write "Shot By Man-Animal" as the cause of death in the Security Field Report, unless I see it with my own eyes. (end of discussion) - This isn't a request, it's an order. Knowing he's treading on dangerous ground, the clerk star

dialogues.text: When the best security chief this planet ever had is leaving, the least I can do js buy him a pan of kerbango on the house. Terl's eyes slit in suspicion. The bartender shrugs, keep voice casual as he continues... BARTENDER (cont'd) And, of course, I'm sure our little agreement is still in effect... (making sure) Now that you're leaving, that little unfortunate incident won't somehow ‘magically' appear in my file. Terl helps himself to a shot of kerbango, then explains-- TERL (cont'd) As long as you provided me useful information, I wouldn't file the report. (matter-of-fact) But now that I'm leaving this pitiful excuse for a planet, you will no longer be providing me with useful information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The color drains from the bartender's face. Terl strolls chuckling, quite pleased with how fun that was. ~

The technician reaches over and yanks Chrissy's medallion from Jonnie's Jonnie tries to grab it back, but the technician swats hi like he was an insect, then holds up the object to see wh so damn important to the man-animal... And we can now see Chrissy's ‘shiny’ medallion is a SILVE

dialogues.speaker: TERL

TERL (cont'd) This is Executive-Assistant Ker. He's been fully trained to take-over as Security Chief, so there'll be no disruptions with my transfer-- He takes one last sickened look at the humans, declaring-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 . We'll be doing the universe a favor by we exterminating the whole lot of them once we finish mining-out their miserable little planet.

The guards drag the young twin, kicking and screa the branding table and pin him down as the technician low iron toward the trembling youngster's exposed flesh-- Only the iron is no longer in his hands. Wielding it like a weapon, Jonnie knocks the stunned guar from Mickey, then pivots with blurring speed-- = i ’ ian's .

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: --I'm honored by your visit, your Excellency. The obese PLANETSHIP waddles over, flanked by his smarmy- ASSISTANT. They shake paws with the District Manager, the him across the lobby. Terl and Ker follow.

dialogues.speaker: DISTRICT MANAGER
dialogues.text: .-.-How do you stand it? He motions out a window at a tree-filled park. DISTRICT MANAGER (cont'd) Having to spend each day looking out at all that green. And a blue sky.

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP

It was actually my idea. (basks in the glory of) And unless I'm mistaken, my idea has already saved the corporation well over six-hundred thousand credits--

dialogues.speaker: DISTRICT MANAGER
dialogues.text: --I'm afraid you're mistaken.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: «.Sir?

dialogues.speaker: DISTRICT MANAGER

He turns and offers Terl a friendly smile. DISTRICT MANAGER (cont'd) You must be looking forward to getting off this disgusting excuse of a planet.

dialogues.speaker: TERL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © DISTRICT MANAGER . very admirable. And you've done a first- rate job here as interim security chief.

dialogues.speaker: TERL

dialogues.speaker: DISTRICT MANAGER
dialogues.text: ~-We've decided to keep you here for another fifty cycles. (turning the 'dagger') With endless options for renewal. The options, of course, being at Home Office's discretion. Not yours. Terl reacts like he was just given a death sentence. The District Manager leans forward, giving him a knowing look DISTRICT MANAGER (cont'd) The senator has a lot of friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie, Carlo and the rest of the new ‘abductees’ are iss baskets and shoved into line with the rest of the slaves. Concerned by his friend's battered condition, Carlo admon There's no point in trying to fight these things. At least not if you want to keep on living.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: -+-Would you please explain to the senator that if I even had an inkling it was his daughter, I never would have--

dialogues.speaker: DISTRICT MANAGER
dialogues.text: --The senator's exact words to me were, and I'm quoting, “If that blasted Terl tries to talk his way out of it, have him vaporized on the spot". Leaving Terl with that thought, the District Manager stri the platform, relieved to be leaving this crappy little p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is packed and loud. The newly arrived Psychlo w getting plastered on kerbango while losing money paw-over laser bash and other assorted rigged games of ‘chance’. Terl storms up to the bar. The bartender looks up, surpri

dialogues.text: You're still here. And something suddenly snaps deep inside Terl. He grabs K pulling him close, the words coming fast and furious--

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: I can assure you I was not groomed since birth to get some ‘cushy job‘ that even a moron like you could perform! While you were trying to learn to spell your name, I was being trained how to conquer galaxies! And doing anything less is a disgrace to my entire family line--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychlo guards patrol the Denver 200, keeping an eye on t humans locked-up for the night. Inside one of the many ca

The hose discharges a green sludge-like food substance in trough. Jonnie starts over to the ‘dinner', but is stoppe FLOYD, a hulking brute of a man almost as large as a Psyc

dialogues.text: You're new, so let me explain how things work. I eat first. Then my men eat. His GANG steps forward. All big and dangerous looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Psychlo finishes discharging the food and retracts th From his P.O.V., Jonnie and Floyd's confrontation is unin like animals "talking" to each other in a z00, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his gang backing him up, Floyd explains to Jonnie--

dialogues.speaker: FLOYD
dialogues.text: After we're done, if there's any food left, you can have it with the others. Given how malnourished the ‘others’ look, it doesn't appe there's usually much food left.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: That's how it used to work. With blinding speed, Jonnie scoops up a flaming log from fire, and before Floyd can react-- P 3 f09 Jonnie SLAMS the club-like wood, full-force, into Floyd's dropping him hard to the ground. Only a moment later... And other than a bloody nose, he shows no effect from the just took. Jonnie smashes him again-- ‘But this time the big brute is ready for it, so all it s do is just piss him off. He grabs Jonnie by the throat an begins to choke the life from him. Jonnie desperately tries to break-free, but Floyd is too ‘He holds Jonnie out at arm's length, preventing Jonnie f getting at him as he continues to brutally strangle Jonni And with his attacker finally close enough to reach, Jonn hand rockets out, p: Floyd staggers back, struggling to breath. With his eyes Floyd releases Jonnie and focuses on reinserting the tube Jonnie locks his hands together and swings them like a ba bat, delivering a tremendous blow to Floyd's jaw. Floyd falls to the ground. And this time he stays there, the count. Jonnie takes mercy on the big man and sticks t back into his nose, then heads over to the trough... But realizes everyone else is holding back, respectfully him eat first. Jonnie shakes his head, declaring--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Everyone eats at the same time. The men all rush the trough... The slop might be disgusting, but at least it's sustenanc PULLING BACK, we realize we're watching this on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall full of MONITORS showing live feeds from all over city. On an adjacent wall-- A sign reads: YouR CHIEF OF SECURITY IS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker despondently removes his picture from under the sign, with an audible sigh, hammers Terl's picture back up. And PULLING BACK yet again, we realize we're watching thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone monitor perched next to a bed, where Terl opens a

dialogues.speaker: FOOTLOCKER
dialogues.text: All neatly packed for what should have been his return ho Terl almost looks like he's going to cry as he starts to But he suddenly stops. Sensing it... His eyes instinctively going to the monitor, which shows-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker peering out the windows, making sure no one is watchi before reaching into his.. tol. oe

dialogues.speaker: DESK
dialogues.text: Inside the hidden false bottom of a drawer, Ker pulls out SURVEILLANCE PHOTO of a mountain range, and...

dialogues.speaker: TERL'S DESK
dialogues.text: Deposits tlie document at the bottom of an "In-Basket" on but suddenly freezes as he can hear someone approaching t Ker dives across the room back to his own desk, snatching crossword puzzle, which he pretends to be working on as.. Terl marches in and heads straight to his desk, where he the surveillance photo. Ker tries to play it cool.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: I was wondering when you were going to look at that. It same in last week and I put it straight in your--

dialogues.speaker: . TERL
dialogues.text: If you're going to lie to me, at least have the decency to do a credible job. (dead serious) So, I don't look like a complete idiot for having tried to train you. He sharply jabs a talon toward Ker's secret hiding place. face goes death-white. How could Terl possibly know? But then Ker suddenly realizes. His eyes probing the room

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: You said we use picto-cameras to spy on other offices. But under no circumstance do we spy on our own office!

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: That's right. We don't. cee cee ne (matter-of-fact) I do. (re: the photo) | Start talking. Given the look in Terl's eyes, Ker decides his best chanc come clean, and to do it fast-- :

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: The photo's from last week's recon drone. It shows a glacier that just split open. It exposed a gold vein... Terl glances at the photo, then gives Ker a knowing look.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: And you were going to wait until after I transferred to turn it in, so you could get all the credit for it, yourself.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: (sheepish nod) I didn't think you'd mind. He regrets it the moment he said it. Braces himself for t punishment he knows must be coming. But surprisingly... -

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: I don't mind. Go ahead.and turn it in. (hands Ker the photo) But first, pretend you're not a complete imbecile and check the compo-gradients. Ker looks down, studying a miniature row of color bars at very bottom of the photo. His face falls as he realizes..

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: The mountain's full of uranium. No Psychlo can get near it without their breath-gas exploding. (despondent) There's no way to mine the gold-- A HAMMER suddenly nails Ker in the back, dropping him to Terl swings again. This time harder. Savagely beating Ker

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: --But What I Do Mind Is That You Betrayed Me Over A Lousy Recon Photo!

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: But It's Worthless! You Just Said So Yourself!

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Yes! But You Didn't know It Was Worthless-- He ratess +he hammer with lethal intent Bnd withait heait

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only Ker manages to scramble out of the way at the last m He grabs the hammer from Terl and scrambles to his feet-— But freezes as Terl pulls his BLAST-GUN. KER (cont'd) You can't shoot me! It's against regulations. I'm not just some man- animal you can kill for sport--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Terl reaches for the trigger and... Stops. Staring at gun, his mind racing... Terl's eyes snap to the surveillance photo... Then to a m showing humans working in the mines... Then back to the g And_it suddenly connects for Terl. Ker mistakes all of this for same cruel pause before his inevitable execution and continues to plead--

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: Please! I'll Make It Up To You, I Swear! Don't Shoot Me-- Terl looks shocked by the very suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Shoot you? My most trusted colleague? Be holsters his gun and throws a friendly arm around Ker. TERL (cont'd) Of course not. We've got work to do. Ker clearly has no idea in hell what Terl's talking about long as it involves not getting shot, he's all for it. : TERL (con*'d) Tomorrow morning, we have to warn the _ Planetship about the “mutiny”.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: «+-What "mutiny"?

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: The one you're going to pretend is in the works, like your life depended on it... (dead serious) Because it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The setting sun casts a shadow over CHRISSY, who sits on keeping a hopeful eye on the far side of the ravine. We g feeling she spends a lot of time on that rock, watching a A WITHERED HAND grips her shoulder. She turns around to f Parson, who gives Chrissy a concerned look--

dialogues.speaker: PARSON
dialogues.text: He's been gone over three months. (the grim reality) If the monsters didn't get him, he would have been back by now-- Chrissy whirls back to the ravine with a relieved smile. there's nothing there. Only now we can here it... The feint sound of GALLOPING HOOFS. Growing louder as-- A flash of white is now visible on the far side of the ca Rocketing up the incline and over the drawbridge and... Chrissy's smile instantly evaporates as she realizes Wind is_returning riderless

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Planetship and his Assistant are stretched-out on CHA LOUNGES. But right now the Planetship looks anything but Across from him, Terl and Ker sit on a chaise-lounge next sun-lamp. Terl and Ker have concerned looks on their face

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: .»-And if this worker revolt takes place, my informants tell me the first order of business will be to separate you from your head. © . :

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: Which is why there will be no mutiny! (panic in his voice) I'm authorizing you to use whatever means necessary to stop it. Terl nods, so far so good. Then continues...

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Our best chance to prevent this mutiny is to increase profits. So we don't have to keep cutting the worker's pay.

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSEIP
dialogues.text: Production equals profits. And I'm already bringing in as many new workers as possible to boost production.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: But we have to pay those new workers. The Assistant Planetship gives Terl a snide look

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT PLANET
dialogues.text: Maybe you were absent the day they , taught econo at the academy, Terl scoffs) . But nobody works for free.  acne i LE CIE

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Man-animals do. A WAITRESS in low-cut garb slinks over with a tray of dri the Planetship waves her off, keeping his attention on Te TERL (cont'd) We already use them for manual labor... What if we could train them to take-on certain additional duties? Like operating mining machines. (quickly adds) That. way we can boost production increasing expenses. The Planetship and his Assistant wait for the punch-line. there isn't one. So they roar with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: Man-animals operate a machine?! Have you blown a head-gasket?!

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT PLANETSEIP
dialogues.text: It's hard enough to keep them from peeing on the carpet. But mining?!

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: I'd be the laughing stock of the entire universe. _ Exactly what Terl was hoping he'd say.

dialogues.speaker: . TERL
dialogues.text: Which is why you should have me take some man-animals and equipment out to a remote area. It's better you don't know where... And I‘ll try to train them. (nonchalant shrug) Have them do some test-mining. That way, if it doesn't work out, no one will know.

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: And if it does work, I'll be vaporized. It's against the law to train an--

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: --According to Regulations: volume 989, Article 34-A, Paragraph 19... A Planetship faced with a profit- threatening situation, such as a mutiny, is relieved of any and all lesser ordinances in the pursuit of protecting said profits. The Planetship chews on this. He can't argue with the log But shakes his head anyway, abruptly declaring--

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: We stick to the original plan! Bring in more workers and they go on half-pay as soon as they arrive. And that's final! And before anyone can say anything--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Planetship JUMPS OFF the third floor railing. And nob seems the least bit surprised by this. Probably because.. The first two floors have been turned into a Psychlo-size pool. But instead of water, it's filled with an oily flui Planetship rubs the sludge into his fur, squirming in del

dialogues.text: Under the glow of first-light, Chrissy rides Windsplitter

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAWBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Which the sentries hold in a raised position, preventing leaving. They do this under the supervision of the Parson She throws the club with perfect aim, knocking open--

dialogues.speaker: THE CATCH
dialogues.text: On the pulley mechanism allowing the rope to unwind, lowe bridge. And before anyone can react-- . Chrissy gallops Windsplitter like a shot across the bridg disappearing at full-tilt down the hillside. EXT. DENVER STREET -- THE NEXT MORNING’ . A cold and brutal Psychlo march song plays over loudspeak long line of exhausted and freezing humans are escorted a point out to the mines. In the rear of the procession... The young twins, Mickey and Sammy, work their way over to

dialogues.text: We hear you're planning a break-out.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: Count us in-- A Psychlo thrusts Jonnie forward with the butt of a gun, him moving with the parade of human misery passing by--

dialogues.speaker: TERL AND KER
dialogues.text: Who enjoy their breakfast out on the heated patio of the Officer Mess Hall.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: I did some research on man-animals last night. They actually possessed certain primitive technical abilities... . (beat) Surprisingly, they even managed to fire a crude probe into space. He slaps a picture of PIONEER ONE onto the table. Ker sho yellow meat into his mouth as he eyes the photo, dubious.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: How do we know it came from man-animals?

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Because they were stupid enough to put a plaque on it with pictures of themselves. One of our deep-space recons picked it up. And here's the kicker... Be points to the plaque visible in the photo. TERL (cont'd) The plaque was made from a rare metal that's worth a clanking fortune. And in addition to their pictures, the man- animals also included full directions to their planet. That's how we came here... (loves this part) They invited us. Ker cracks-up, finding this hysterical. Terl leans forwar giving him a conspiratorial wink. TERL (cont'd) «--And of course, all this means the plan has a good chance of working. Terl gets up and heads out. Confused, Ker chases after hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catching up to Terl, Ker shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: But the plan can't work if the Planetship doesn't order us to train man-animals--

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: --The Planetship's hiding something. : All we have to do is figure out what it is, and we'll have leverage over him.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: (getting it) And then we can get the gold--

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: ---What do you mean we? It's my plan. And before Ker can respond, Terl heads into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ) - And settles in behind his desk. Ker follows on his he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, sir. You got to let me in on it. I barely make any credits in this lousy job. And I've got five wives to support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fTerl leans back in his chair, rubbing a talon over his l pretending to be thinking this over. And finally...

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: I don't want to partner-up with an idiot. (challenges) How do I even know you understand the plan? Still reclining in his chair, Terl discreetly reaches und desk and pushes a GREEN BUTTON. This isn't seen by-- Ker, who rising to the task, holds up the surveillance ph the mountain range.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: We train man-animals, who don't need breath-gas, to mine the gold for us.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: But Home Planet owns this planet. The gold belongs to them. Ker nods, eager to prove he understands the whole plan.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: That's the beauty of it. Home Office doesn't even know the gold exists. So those corporate crap-heads will never know we stole it. It's the perfect crime. He waits for Terl's praise... But instead Terl looks shoc And in the gravest of voices:

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Putting aside the serious violations of teaching mining to an inferior race and insulting corporate superiors, each one in themselves punishable by death, you just advocated deliberate theft of company resources... (resigned sigh) So my duty requires me to report you, even though you will be vaporized and I'll have to train a new assistant. Ker's jaw is practically on the floor. Terl promptly push RED BUTTON under his desk before--

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: But it was your stinking idea!

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Which is why it's a good thing I now have a recording of you laying out the plan, and me reprimanding you for it.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?! We don't have any recorders planted in here... (realizes) Let me guess. We don't. But you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl saunters over to a--

dialogues.speaker: VAULT
dialogues.text: —™ Where he carefully positions his body to shield a KEYP \ Ker's view, as he punches in numbers. a!

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Consider it part of your education.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: «+Education?! The vault swings open. Terl reaches in past a shelf of Bl and spare air-tanks, popping a disc fram a RECORDING MACH

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Never engage in a criminal activity until you set-up a patsy to pin everything on in case you're found out.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: Thank-you. That's great advice! But why do I have to be the patsy?!

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: So you won't be getting any bright ideas about getting rid of ‘ole Terl in order . to keep all the gold for yourself. : : ve

dialogues.speaker: . KER
dialogues.text: But I would never double-cross you!’

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Of course not. Because I'm going to set it up that if any ‘unfortunate accident’ were to befall me... (re: the disc) This goes straight to Home Office. He files the disc away within a collection of other such recordings housed within the vault, then shuts and locks door. Ker isn't happy about this, but what can he do? And to ma things worse, he realizes...

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: Your whole plan depends on getting leverage over the Planetship. (shakes his head) But since there's no way to smuggle a picto-recorder into his office without it being detected, how are we going to find out what he's hiding--

dialogues.speaker: . TERL
dialogues.text: } .- --You're the only qualified E-3 Level Support Executive on this planet other than the Assistant Planetship. (matter-of-fact) So if something were to ‘accidentally’ happen to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching on) ---Zid be the only qualified candidate to replace him. Good thinking, sir! (rubs his paws together) So how do we bump the bastard off?

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Don't worry about that. We'll do it in an appropriate style... But right now, _we have a more pressing concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl and Ker enjoy their lunch up in a guard tower overlo the humans slaving away below. Between mouthfuls, Ter] mo down to JONNIE, who struggles with a heavy load of ore. With almost a sense of begrudging respect, Terl explains.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: +. While that one does seem to be unusually intelligent and resourceful, at least for a man-animal, it also seems rather defiant. Which is why we'll need leverage over it. :

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: Leverage over a man-animal? | _ Merl gives him a sharp look. Hasn't he been paying at The only way it's going to be able to operate a mining machine is if it can read Psychlo. Which means we have to educate it on a learning machine. Ker looks at Terl like he's off his rocker.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: But if anyone found out--

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: --Thatis why we need leverage on it, you moron! 6&0, no one finds out. Ker stares down at Jonnie, exhausted by the idea.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: We need leverage on the Planetship. And now we need leverage on the man-animals. I don't know about this plan of yours... (mutters) It's like we need leverage on everyone.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: That's what makes it so much fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychlo COOKS mix a disgusting green slop in giant tubs.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: .-.We feed them a combination of grass, reclaimed fluid wastes, and whatever animal carcasses we can find.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Yes, but what would man like to eat? (clarifies) What would they consider a treat? COOK eee eee Wow the crap should I know?! (quickly adds--) Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker dejectedly kicks a rock as he follows Terl up the str

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: So much for your "Positive-Forcing". TERL . It's called Positive-Reinforcement. — Whatever. It still sounds like a pretty primitive way to get leverage.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Man is a primitive species. Ker can't argue with that, but still shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: But we have no idea what the damn things like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker barges into the cage, and without warning, throws Jon Carlo and Floyd into a-- TRANSPORTABLE CARGO CAGE. Mickey and Sammy, trying to stay close to Jonnie, start t scramble into the cage, but Ker swats them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker secures the cargo cage to the back of a flatbed truck tosses HEAVY JACKETS to our guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker, wearing a breath-tube now that he's outside the dome the flatbed truck up a windy mountain road away from Denv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys huddle in their jackets as the cold Colorado air through the cage. Floyd shrugs, guessing...

dialogues.speaker: FLOYD
dialogues.text: «Must be a mining site out here. Carlo looks to Jonnie for his take on the situation. But Jonnie's attention turns to the cargo cage door as-- The truck hits a small bump, causing the door to swing op crack, betraying that it's not locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flatbed truck rounds a bend, carrying a NOW EMPTY cag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys pick themselves off the road from where they jum race away in escape, sprinting up a mountain path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl and Ker, reclining in chairs with their feet up on d TRIO OF MONITORS showing our guys huffing and puffing up

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: They sure are slow. And it looks like they're slowing down even more.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: That's the whole point of this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys make it up over a small rise, where Floyd sudden hopeful eye at a CABIN-LIKE BUILDING half-buried up ahead

dialogues.speaker: FLOYD
dialogues.text: Might be some food in there.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: We don't have time. The monsters are going to be coming after us.

dialogues.speaker: FLOYD
dialogues.text: We gotta eat. fi j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our best chance of hiding is up in the tree-line. We'll look for food there-- Carlo hates to take Floyd's side, but...

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: If I don't eat now, I'm not sure I'm going to make it to the tree line. Jonnie starts to respond, but one look at Carlo and Floyd it's clear they're both on the brink of exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl proudly points to the monitors, which show our guys open a door and heading into the snow-covered building. TERL . observe them in their natural habitat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building is a long-abandoned SKI CHALET, caught froze time.. A thick layer of dust covers everything. In the co The SKELETAL REMAINS of some people are scattered near a Tree slumped over a pile of presents for a holiday never But Jonnie suddenly freezes. Grabs a CHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: FLOYD
dialogues.text: What is it-=

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: +».Lunch. Be launches the chair straight at the--

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS TREE
dialogues.text: Sending RATS scurrying out from among the presents. Jonni onto one of the larger rodents. Carlo and Floyd do likewi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlo and Floyd rip branches from the Christmas tree for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time for a fire.

dialogues.speaker: FLOYD
dialogues.text: We don't have a choice. We gotta cook the rats--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: --We have a cheice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo : i i ie's thinking. to looks up in dread as he realizes what Jonnie s Sonnie gumons up every ounce of willpower he's got and .. a bi raw .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker shakes his head, nauseated.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Get off your fat ass! We got the info we needed, let's.go round ‘em up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys sprint up the road, when they begin to hear an o MECHANICAL ROAR behind them. Getting louder as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An armored Psychlo MARK II GROUND’CAR hurtles above the g it comes screaming up toward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys, who charge past a faded ‘Welcome to Aspen' sign way around a bend-- But as they top the hili, they run straight into one of Teri's backup vehicles. Psychios piling out. Jonnie goes berserk! The first two Psychlo guards stood no chance. With one backward stride, Jonnie is behind them. He sends them slamming together like egg shells. He catches the gun of one, as that Psychlo goes down and stamps his heel into the side of his skull. He reverses the gun and batters the other Psychlo with sh from a range of three inches. Jonnie drops on one knee, and blows the two last Psychlos have exited the craft to bits. Five other Psychlos fire in his direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie's gun is empty. He throws it down and picks up the other one. Flips the switch to kill. Totally unmindful of the shots ripping up the ground, run low and firing as he goes, Jonnie races on. The others scattering around him. ‘He kneels behind a Psychlo body and sends a storm of sho into the five. They crash back. Jonnie pounds them into rolling bails of dead flesh. Runn firing as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they abruptly run out of ground. Standing at the br a massive chasm where a--

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Used to be. But neglect and repeated winter storms have w it away into the bottom of a canyon almost too far down t And to make matters worse, our guys are surrounded on all sheer vertical mountain face, impossible to climb. They'r

dialogues.speaker: FLOYD
dialogues.text: What the hell do we do now?! “CARLO Don't even think about it-- This is directed at the look in Jonnie's eyes as he stare the gorge... CARLO (cont'd) There's no way you're going to make that jump! And in fact, the far side of the ravine does seem like an long distance away. But Jonnie backs up, getting as much room as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Psychlo Ground Car hurtles around the last bend and c screaming out onto the clearing as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie takes off on a dead sprint, going like hell for th the cliff. Carlo looks away, can't bear the sight. Jonnie doesn't let-up. In fact, he goes faster. Every mus straining as he races straight for the edge and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PSYCHLO FIGHTER PLANE rockets up from the depths of the blocks J ie f Sane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl maneuvers the fighter plane to push Jonnie away from edge of the gorge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl locks our guys into the rear of the ground car as... Ker stares across the canyon to the other side, trying to something out. And then it finally dawns on him.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: They must be able to fly. Terl sighs, unlocks the cage and grabs Floyd and tosses h the side of the canyon

dialogues.speaker: FLOYD
dialogues.text: Screams in helpless anguish as he plunges to his death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remains of a sizable meal are scattered over a giant to a steel slab, where the ASSISTANT PLANETSHIP partakes A door bursts open and Ker marches inside and salutes.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: I need your approval to get some man- animal labor units to do some painting and cleaning work. He extends a REQUISITION FORM, which the still half-aslee Assistant Planetship signs, but then snidely instructs--

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: You tell Terl, that unlike ‘certain individuals', I hold an important job. So next time he has a request, have him send it through proper channels instead of disturbing me when I'm busy. Ker nods, then trots out with the signed form. The Assist Planetship scratches himself, then returns to his snooze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is packed with its usual drunken debauchery. In back, Terl and the bartender engage in a private conversa  ~-~ew

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Given that it looks like I'll be sticking around for a while, perhaps we should be discussing the terms of our new deal...

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: (resigned sigh) +--What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Assistant Planetship finishes a pan of kerbango when more pans of the narcotic root are placed in front of him

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You're our one- thousandth customer of the month!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Assistant Planetship, now smashed out of his mind, st into his room to sleep off the kerbango... '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A recording of the Assistant Planetship plays on.a monito

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT PLANETSHIP, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: You tell Terl, that unlike ‘certain ' individuals', I hold an important job-- Ker watches as Terl pauses the recording, then expertly i the Assistant Planetship's voice:

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: "You tell Terl, that unlike ‘certain individuals', I hold an important job.”

dialogues.speaker: KR
dialogues.text: (genuinely impressed) How do you do that, sir? You sound just like him.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: There are benefits to a first-class education. Terl hits play again, mimicking the Assistant Planetship' expressions and gestures playing on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl masterfully applies prosthetics »nd make-up to his f thickening his eye bones and darkening the fur on his che Until if we didn't know it was Terl, we'd swear it was th Assistant Planetship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl, disguised as the Assistant Planetship, shakes his h

dialogues.speaker: TERL, (AS ASSIST. PLANETSHIP)
dialogues.text: .-When Terl gave this suggestion in the meeting, I ridiculed it. Know why? The RESEARCH CLERK doesn't really care, but politely asks

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCH CLERK
dialogues.text: No, sir. Why? TERL (AS ASSIST. PLANETSHIP) . I'm no fool. I'm going to steal Terl's idea for myself... Because that Terl is exceptionally brilliant, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCH CLERK
dialogues.text: I haven't noticed. He always seemed like an arrogant jerk to me. Terl's eyes slit, but he forces himself to stay in charac

dialogues.speaker: TERL, (AS ASSIST. PLANETSHIP)
dialogues.text: .. Well, if you got to know him, I'm sure you wouldn't think that. : |

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ‘Research Clerk shrugs, returning to the business at

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCH CLERK
dialogues.text: You want discs on basic Psychlo Language. Research Compendium on Man-Animals. Mineral and Ore Mining Techniques. And Door-Bomb Explosives... (beat) If I may ask, sir, what's that one for? Terl signs a check-out slip, expertly forging the Assista PRlanetship's sionature, then... Making a big production of looking around, making sure no listening, Terl leans in with a conspiratorial whisper...

dialogues.speaker: TERL, (AS ASSIST. PLANETSHIP)
dialogues.text: .»..Can you keep a secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker barges in and snaps a LEASH around Jonnie's neck. Car same treatment. And as Ker reaches out to grab some more Mickey and Sammy, discreetly slip forward, positioning th to be selected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker hands’ Psychlo-sized paint-brushes to Carlo, the twin WEYWOOD, an older man with a friendly face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pointing to giant buckets of purple paint, Ker barks some Psychlo, which the humans obviously can't understand.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: How we supposed to know what he wants?

dialogues.speaker: HEYWOOD
dialogues.text: They've made me do this before. Just follow what I do and you'll be fine. He dips his brush into a bucket and goes to work painting Carlo and the twins copy his movements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl roughly deposits Jonnie and the chair in the center room, then grabs a DISC from a pile and slides it into--

dialogues.speaker: A LEARNING MACHINE
dialogues.text: - Which unlike the utilitarian design of most Psychlo mac elegantly designed with sleek simplicity. And once the disc is inserted, the machine emits a hologr of a CHINKO, which bows twice and puts its six sets of pa six eyes, then talks in English, albeit with a strange ac

dialogues.speaker: CHINKO VOICE, (FROM THE MACHINE)
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but I am your instructor if you will forgive such arrogance, for I do not have the honor to be a Psychlo. I am but a lowly Chinko Language Slave in the Department of Culture and Ethnology. The holographic image bows again, then...

dialogues.speaker: CHINKO VOICE, (FROM THE MACHINE)
dialogues.text: Please forgive my pretension as I try to educate you in Psychlo, the Noble language of Conquerors... An intense bright shaft of BLUE LIGHT shoots out of the m striking Jonnie in the eyes...

dialogues.speaker: CHINKO VOICE, (FROM THE MACHINE)
dialogues.text: This machine is designed for pan-species communication, and utilizes subconscious absorption, allowing for instantaneous comprehension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A somber Psychlo war song plays from speakers as Carlo, H and the twins paint the walls a fresh coat of purple. Terl happily hums along to the music as he attaches some RED-SQUARE to a choke collar. Ker is camped-out at his ow looking through some holographic pornography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue light beaming at Jonnie's eyes clicks off. And s in Jonnie's P.0,V.: Terl leans down to Jonnie, speaking very slowly, extra-en each syllable... :

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: ‘Hello...there...Do...You...Understand... What... I'm... Saying?... Jonnie can understand, but feigns a blank expression, pre he doesn't. Terl dangles a DEAD RAT in front of Jonnie's

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Are...You...Hungry...Little...Guy?.. But Jonnie keeps up his blank-face routine. Terl continues to ‘tease’ him with the rodent for a few b then pulls it away and restarts the machine, turning to K . TERL (cont'd) Obviously, this is going to take a : while. We might as well go get ourselves some lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl and Ker head out the door. The moment they're gone, charges into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tackles Jonnie out of the chair, ‘saving’ him from th beam bombarding his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: Told you your attitude was going to get you into trouble. That's why the monsters singled you out for the torture machine.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what it is, but it's not torture. It's like sleeping. But when you wake-up, you somehow know things... (explains) Like I can now understand what the monsters are saying when they speak. Heywood appears in the doorway with a concerned look.

dialogues.speaker: HEYWOOD
dialogues.text: «--What's going on? Carlo points to the Learning Machine with religious awe.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: It's a god-machine that the monsters must have stolen. It makes you know things.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: I don't know if it's a god-machine, but I do know I'm going to use it to learn as much as I can, so I can figure out how the hell we're going to get out of here. _ Before Heywood can protest, Jonnie reassures him-- JONNIE (cont'd) If you can keep an eye out and give me a little bit of warning before the monsters come back, I won't be putting any of you.in danger. Heywood is concerned, but moves back to a window, keeping vigilant eye on the street outside as... Jonnie inserts a new disc into the Learning Machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner of the cage, out of view of the others, Jon a stick to fervently work out mathematical equations in t Carlo, Heywood and the twins watch, trying to make sense foreign symbols. :

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: --.So, that's what the monster's’ language looks like. Jonnie shakes his head, his eyes shining with the rapture knowledge as he explains... .

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: This is mathematics. The unifying ~ language of the entire universe. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker shrugs between mouthfuls of his lunch.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: ---So it's taking a bit longer with the man-animals than we thought. But they can't be completely brainless if they were able to fire a probe into space~-

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: ---I'm not sure the man-animals did fire that probe into space.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: But you said there was a plaque on it with the man-animal's picture, Terl slowly sips a pan of kerbango as he explains.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: What if there was a species on a different planet that detested man- animals, and it's easy to see why they would... And this other species, wanting man-animals exterminated, sent the probe to us with directions to the man-animal's planet.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: (beat) I hadn't thought of that. It's very clever, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie watching Terl and Ker on a monitor, while reading a Psychlo FIELD OPERATIONS MANUAL. In the rear of the room, the rest of the guys push and pu the handle to the massive VAULT.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: {translating from the manual) The Security-Chief should secure the field vault with an eight-digit combination code of his selection. He should not write this code down, or tell it to anyone else. And he shouldn't simply use his Employee ID number, but be more clever than that. Carlo gives Jonnie a hopeful look.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: You don't think...? Jonnie digs through Terl's desk, coming up with a FORM.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: The monster in charge is named Terl. | (beat) His employee number is on this requisition form... He returns Carlo's look with a shrug. JONNIE (cont'd) It's worth a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie punches Terl' s . An entry light blinks rea ea eye number_into S red and the door remains cuers MICKEY uess he was more clever than that. Jonnie nods, but then-- the vault's keypad. locked.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: But the question is, how clever? Let's . try putting the numbers in reverse order He inputs Terl's employee Id-Number in reverse order. A b the entry light blinks green and the vault swings open. Our guys enter. Jonnie's attention is drawn to the RECORD MACHINE, while Carlo, Heywood and the twins check-out the Guns and spare Breath-Gas Tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl and Ker march past Heywood, Carlo and the twins, who busy painting the walls, and head straight into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time, Terl dangles two dead rats in front Jonnie.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Do...You...Want...Lunch?... But Jonnie keeps up his blank-face routine. And is reward for it by being picked-up by the head and launched out in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie skids across the floor, slamming into a wall. Terl impatiently marches over to him, pulling his Blast-Gun.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: It's obviously asking too much of these man-animal things to grasp a language as sophisticated as Psychlo. But Ker isn't willing to give-up hope of the gold and tri sound convincing as--

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: What if this one is particularly stupid? Why don't we try to train another one--

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: ~--We don't have time! He storms over and grabs a series of surveillance photos desk. Jonnie discreetly signals across the room to... Carlo, who holds his breath, praying he doesn't get caugh He slowly reaches between Terl's legs and pushes the GREE recording as...

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: I can't keep hiding the recon-photos from Home Office, forever. Plus, at the rate the glacier is melting, the gold's about to fall into the ravine.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: ---S0, we'll get .it then.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: We'd have to use explosives. Home Office would detect them and send down a survey team, which means we wouldn't be able to keep the gold for ourselves. Be takes one last forlorn look at the photos, then lashes anger, delivering a vicious kick to Jonnie. TERL (cont'd) And this damn thing's been on the machine for two full days now, and still can't even speak one word! It's hopeless. (mind made up) We terminate the operation and cover our tracks. He points his blast-gun down at Jonnie and--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: What word would you like me to speak? Terl stares at Jonnie in amazement. The man-animal just s Psychlo. But to make sure he's not imagining this... TERL . ---What did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: You heard me. I asked you what word...

dialogues.speaker: CARLO, BEYWOOD AND THE TWINS P.O.V
dialogues.text: The rest of the guys can't understand what Jonnie's sayin they're shocked to realize... He's speaking to the monsters in their machine-like langu

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: In an unprecedented public display of joy, hops up and do pumping his arms in victory.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: It speaks! It actually speaks! (as if Jonnie was a toy) Goon. Say something else.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Okay. How's this? You're going to stay here as our prisoner... (instructs Ker) While you go and bring back a truck. Terl, more amused than anything, clarifies...

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Just because I taught you how to speak Psychlo, you're still the inferior race... Which means I give you orders. Xou don't give me orders. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: I understand that if you don't do exactly what we tell you to do, we'll have no choice but to kill you both.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Oh, really? And how exactly do you plan to do that-- Jonnie gives the signal. With a sudden flurry of movement Carlo, Heywood, and the twins pull BLAST-GUNS from behind paint buckets. Jonnie keeps his attention on Terl.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: The next time you chose an access code, you might want to be a bit more clever than just using your ID number in reverse. _ But Terl‘s only reaction is to chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: You sure they even know how to use those things-- A COLLECTIVE CLICK as our guys slam the levers down on th to kill position. Ker immediately throws his arm up in pu And Terl is no longer chuckling. He looks around at the g pointed at him and buries his head in his paws, and begin Howl with laughter. Convulsing so hard, tears run down hi TERL (cont'd) Can you imagine the official report? (gasps for air) Head of Security killed by man-animals! Still laughing hysterically, he rears back to smack Jonni Mickey jumps forward and FIRES his gun at Terl-- Only there's nothing but a CLICK. The weapon doesn't fire Sammy leaps forward and fires his Blaster. CLICK. His gun doesn't work either. Carlo and Heywood get the same resul

dialogues.speaker: HEYWOOD
dialogues.text: +.-Uh-oh. Terl, still laughing, follows through on his swing, sendi flying across the room. Then explains to him with a smirk

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: If you rat-brains knew anything about firearm safety, you'd know one doesn't store loaded weapons. Then he turns to take care of the others. Goes to smack S But Mickey protectively grabs a LETTER-OPENER from a desk blinding speed, plunges the blade straight for Terl's che ' Only as fast as Mickey is, Terl is faster, and he defle \ blow with his arm, sustaining a small cut in the proces Terl then promptly relieves Mickey of the letter-opener a the trembling twin by the throat, holding him firmly in p

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Next time you want to stab someone, let me show you how to do it right-- He raises the sharp blade high above Mickey's chest--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: (steel in his voice) You hurt him, I won't mine your gold! fTerl pauses to consider this. Then turns and convincingl TERL . } Then I'll vaporize you and get someone . else to mine the gold-- cy

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: --You don't have time. You can't keep hiding the recon-photos from Home Office, ' forever. And the glacier is melting. In that one moment, Terl's whole world is turned upside d Jonnie gives Terl a dangerous smile. JONNIE (cont'd) Man getting leverage over a Psychlo. That would be the day, wouldn't it? Rage burns openly in Terl's eyes, but he lowers the weapo calmly turns to Ker.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: «+I think it's time we showed our little friend here a thing or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mark II Ground Car is parked in front of the library. L in a cage in the rear of the vehicle-- Sv ‘

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlo, Heywood and the twins watch with concern as Terl d Jonnie by a leash across the street and up marble steps.  ©

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl’s usual deep throated voice sounds even more ominous echoes eerily in the library's expansive entryway.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: As long as you cling to the feeble hope that you can get the better of me, you'll be distracted from the important work which needs to be done. Which is why I share the following with you... He gives the leash a good hard jerk, yanking Jonnie down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl moves at his normal gait, forcing Jonnie to run to k TERL (cont'd) When we attacked your planet, all your soldiers, using your best military technology, were only able to put-up a measly nine minute fight before we exterminated them, along with all but a few of the six billion humans polluting this planet. He snaps the leash, whiplashing Jonnie into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shelves lining this cavernous tomb of a room are stac of books. An endless variety of subjects and titles. TERL (cont'd) Everything you humans knew is in here. He makes a big production of letting go of the leash, giv Jonnie full run of the place. TERL (cont'd) And you can look at anything you want. Because there's nothing that can help you. He watches amused as Jonnie takes him up on his offer, pu books from shelves. Terl can't resist calling after him-- TERL (cont'd) But I'm sure you'll find a lot of recipes on how to prepare raw rat. Terl cracks-up, finding this particularly entertaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey pensively shakes his head, fearing the worst.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: Think he's still alive?

dialogues.speaker: HEYWOOD
dialogues.text: If he is, he probably wishes he wasn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A darkness hangs over the cage as everyone continues to s at the library, where--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl is filing his talons. Across from him, Jonnie finish looking through a large stack of books. 1 Satisfied? ’ JONNIE Yes. As Jonnie heads for the door, Terl steals a peek at the b was just looking at. It's the Declaration of Independence But Terl can't read English. Unconcerned, he just shrugs, swatting the book across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: or ws Ona rise overlooking the domed city, a herd of graz —y curious stares across the field as the Mark II Ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl emerges from the vehicle, followed by Jonnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ' / You will soon be relocated to a new mining site. And if any of you get any bright ideas about escaping, keep in mind that while you rat-brains may not know anything about firearms, I certainly do. I just happened to be top marksman of my graduating class. And I can kill any of you at well over a thousand paces... (to Jonnie) Tell them what I just said.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: (relays to the others) If we try to escape, he'll shoot us. Terl waits for Jonnie to continue. And when he doesn't...

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: That's it? Jonnie nods. Terl is surprised, but shrugs and continues subject at hand. He pulls his Blast-Gun, explaining--  EL A an nnn NNN TERL (cont'd) Allow me to demonstrate. Be turns and FIRES into the middle of the--

dialogues.speaker: GRAZING COWS
dialogues.text: Killing several of the animals. The others take off in a stampede of churning hooves. Terl continues to calmly fir Blasting the legs clean off the fast-moving animals. Send them collapsing to the ground, BELLOWING in anguished tor Terl shows off with some trick shots. From behind the bac With his eyes closed. All with the same horrific result.. The field littered with a bloody sea of suffering animals around helplessly. Sensing something behind them, Jonnie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GRIZZLY BEAR emerges from an abandoned building. Nostri flaring at the smell of blood. And with a growl, he charg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl, who is too busy with his shooting demonstration, to But he does note the look in Jonnie's eyes as Jonnie star away. And misreading it as revulsion to the carnage on th

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Don't you know your own history? Man- kind was the only animal on this planet that hunted other animals for sport... (has to admit) Which means there might be some hope for your species after all-- The GRIZZLY slams into Terl from behind-- The fierce impact jars the gun from Terl's grasp as he's MAULED down. And with the grizzly on his back, pinning hi Terl is unable to get his own talons up at--

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAR
dialogues.text: Who is starting to do damage. Powerful claws savagely sla into Terl's flesh as Terl remains unable to defend himsel Jonnie scoops up the gun, switches it to stun position an Knocking the grizzly flat by the shot. Carlo can't believ

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Let the bear rip him to shreds-- Jonnie raises the weapon on Terl, who bloodied and bruise himself up and gives Jonnie a friendly smile.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Look, we can work out a deal. There's more than enough gold to go around--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: --You're in no position to be making a deal. . He switches the gun into kill position.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: (now understanding) You're right. It's better we kill him. And for the first time, there is_terror in Terl's eyes. H himself, waiting for the shot. He doesn't have to wait lo

dialogues.speaker: KABLAM
dialogues.text: Terl's eyes open wide in shock. He hasn't been hit. The shot was directed at one of the s cows behind him, as Jonnie humanely ends the animal's mis

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Jonnie does the same with the rest of the herd. Terl has at the irony of it...

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: You've learned more Psychlo than I ever thought possible.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: To toy with me like this before you kill me. I'm impressed... (genuinely) You honor me. He closes his eyes, bows his head, ready for his executio Jonnie stands there, the gun now sighted on Terl. His fin aching to pull the trigger. But he doesn't...

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?! Kill him!

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: If I kill him, then what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of here!

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: To what kind of life?! Always looking over out shoulders, waiting for another monster to come hunt us down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERL can't understand what the man-animals are babbling a a But his eyes remain focused on the gun in Jonnie's hand a for a chance to grab it-- But Jonnie keeps the weapon leveled on Terl's chest, as h continues to address the others... JONNIE (cont'd) ' «..And what about the others back at the mining camp?

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: There's nothing we can do about them. (resigned) Only the Gods can free them.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Those lights we see in the sky at night. ) They are not Gods watching down on us.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: «What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: I learned our history, today. Our ancestors built flying machines that went up into the heavens. I saw the ’ pictures with my own. eyes... se . . (re: the stars) © + ¢ . ( A Those are planets. Like this'one. They are not gods waiting to come and save us. He waits a long beat for everyone to digest this, then... } JONNIE (cont'd) And the great villages weren't built by_ . gods. They were built by people, just like us. Men and women who cherished one thing above all else. Freedom. (impassioned) It meant so much to them, they'd fight to the death for it if they had to. In fact, many of them did. Inspired, Mickey immediately steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: You're right... His voice is a bit impulsive, but full of conviction. MICKEY (cont'd) We can't run away from the monsters. We have to fight them! } His brother, Sammy, immediately joins him. Heywood also “ forward in solidarity. But Carlo isn't so sure...

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: How the hell are we going to fight them?  i SS I

dialogues.speaker: CO
dialogues.text: . I'm not sure, yet. But I do know we're A not ready. We need to learn more about them. Like their weaknesses. (concedes) And we're going to have to learn other : stuff as well. I mean, we didn't even ! know the guns weren't going to work. A long beat, then with the look of a man who knows he's g regret this, Carlo steps forward, joining the others with

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: +--Which is why we have to go back. Terl watches as the damnedest thing happens... Jonnie turns to him, returning the gun to him, explaining

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: , Surely someone as smart as you has some ' secret plan to stop me from shooting you. . If I tried, you would have killed me. In the blink of an eye, Terl shifts his demeanor back to , caustic self--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: = if . Damn right I would have, rat-brain! ! . (chortles) That's the first intelligent thing 1 you've said, yet. He points Jonnie to the far edge of the field. TERL (cont'd) Rest-break's over. There's something else you need to see--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl proudly points down to the domed city below.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: That entire city doesn't even equal one block in one of the hundreds of thousands of cities on the great Home Planet of Paychlo. And from there, we control countless outposts all over the universe. Each one much larger than this. One of those outposts used to be : the Chinko's planet. Terl stares Jonnie straight in the eye, making sure he un

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERL (cont'd) The Chinkos were the ones who designed the Learning Machine. They were far ~ . more advanced than you rat-brains. And _ when they tried to revolt, we sent down ( ? our gas drones, and within minutes every ~ last one of them was exterminated. (sure of this) So get it through your little excuse for a brain. There is no way a species as primitive as yours could ever defeat us. He lets Jonnie chew on that for a beat, then concedes... TERL (cont.'d) But you were right about one small thing. If you refuse to mine the gold, I may not have enough time to train anyone else. Which is why it is imperative that you are properly motivated-- A SECOND Mark II Ground Car pulls up. Ker emerges from th vehicle and opens the trunk, pulling out-- ' CERISSY. Relief floods her eyes when she sees Jonnie. At least he' But as hard as it is to do, Jonnie gives Chrissy an emoti vacant look. like she means nothing to him { ) sO And Chrissy senses enough to duplicate this look. ! Jonnie very closely. .

dialogues.speaker: . TERL
dialogues.text: ' ++-You don't know her? He pulls out Chrissy's charcoal drawing of Jonnie. TERL (cont'd) This was on her when she was collected. Jonnie tries to hide the fear in his eyes at what Terl mi He doesn't have to wait long to find out... Terl holds up a CBOKE-COLLAR with a red square on it. TERL (cont'd) This collar has enough explosive to easily remove her head from her body. He secures the collar to Chrissy's neck, then pulls a REM CONTROL. TERL (cont'd) And this remote can activate the explosive from anywhere on the planet. So if you ever disobey me, let me show you exactly what will happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker secures a second red-squared collar around Heywood's

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Listen, you win! I'll mine your gold. And I know you don't owe me any favors... But please, don't kill him! Terl stares at Jonnie. A long beat. Then he finally relen

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Fine... As a gesture to our new working relationship, I will grant you this one request. I won't kill him. But you can never ask for anything else again.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: I won't. And thank-you-- Terl nonchalantly tosses the remote to Ker.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: As I said, I won't kill him... Ker gives Jonnie an evil grin, then slowly pushes the but

dialogues.speaker: KABLAM
dialogues.text: Heywood is no longer among the living. Terl and Ker laugh asses off at the shocked betrayal on Jonnie's face. «..Stupid humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Returning the humans to their cage for the night, Terl st Mickey and Sammy. Impossible to tell the twins apart... The two young brothers watch with growing concern as Terl to them, while asking Jonnie something in Psychlo.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: «--What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: He wants to know which one of you tried to stab him. A look of knowing terror in Mickey's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: Why? What's he going to do?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, there's no way of telling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey nods, accepting his fate, whatever it may be. He t But Sammy has already stepped forward, sacrificing himsel Terl. Mickey, stunned, tries to stop him--

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: » What are you doing?! I'm the one who--

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: --You were just trying to protect me. Terl grabs Sammy and Jonnie and marches away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl straps Sammy to the teleportation platform, then cal drags Jonnie down to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ferl punches commands into a console. Over the hum of the generators coming to life, Terl explains to Jonnie...

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Now that you and I have our little agreement straight, I want you to watch this, so you can tell the others: what'll happen to them if any of you ever disobey me. He points Jonnie's attention to a monitor, beaming back i teleportation platforms on the HOME PLANET OF PSYCHLO as.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATED VOICE, (FROM CONSOLE)
dialogues.text: Teleportation in five... In four... In three... In two... In one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a THUNDER-CLAP of sound and a BLINDING FLASH of ligh Sammy disappears from the platform--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And appears on one of the countless teleportation platfor stretched out under a radiant purple sky. Sammy can't breath the air. Starting to suffocate. Panicking, the youngster desperately undoes the strap tet him to the platform and tries to run to safety, but-- The mich larger planet's immense gravitational pul] crush to his knees. His eyes bulging, he stares out at a--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Endless rows of factories belching fire crammed between o buildings thousands of times taller than the World Trade

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Lets out a gasping plea for help as his spine starts to c under the atmospheric weight. And the last thing he sees

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHLO WORKERS
dialogues.text: Crowding around him in curious amusement. As if observing insect cooking in a microwave. Until... ‘The young twin literally IMPLODES. His body caving in on mercifully ending the suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie rips his eyes away from the abominable scene playi the monitor. In contrast... Terl views it to its bitter end, clucking the whole time enjoyment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of Psychlos crowd around the bar, consuming kérba including the RESEARCH CLERK that Terl checked out the di Ker joins the group, shaking his head despondently.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: I just got the worst news. My cousin Numph got vaporized... - Everyone is surprised by Ker's un-Psychlo like grief. KER (cont'd) ...The bastard owed me over a thousand credits! Now I'll never get it. The group nods, now understanding. KER (cont'd) But it's the idiot's own fault. He knew about a planned mutiny attempt, but failed to report it. The Psychlos give a collective ‘He got what he had coming shrug, then return to their kerbango as... . The research clerk leans over to Ker, nonchalantly inquir

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCH CLERK
dialogues.text: Just wondering. How exactly did they find out he knew about the mutiny?  Neem

dialogues.speaker: KER ,
dialogues.text: He was on a remote rini star planet, not unlike this one, where just like here, they secretly record and archive all conversations. (J This is news to the research clerk. KER (cont'd) So, if there was ever a mutiny, we'd obviously review every recording... (dark laugh) And I'd sure hate to be the poor bastard who knew about it, but didn't report it.
' A guard tosses Jonnie back into the cage. Mickey tentat | approaches him, afraid to ask the question, but has to.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: , What happened to my brother? ! Jonnie stares at him. A long, difficult beat. Then fina

dialogues.speaker: . JONNIE
dialogues.text: , The monster sent him up to their home . planet... Before he can continue, Mickey exhales, relieved. +.-Thank god, because I thought for sure he was going to kill him. Jonnie continues to stare at Mickey, his heart breaking. the life of him, he just can't bring himself to tell him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl hurries down a hallway. A pair of GUARDS snap a salu immediately open a door, allowing him into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker and the research clerk are in the room with the Plane

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me--

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: --It's my assistant! He's the bastard planning the mtiny. Terl does an impressive job of acting shocked by the news

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Assistant Planetship doesn't have to act. He is shock

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: Why the hell would I want to do that?! Terl slips a disc into a machine, playing a recording of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl, convincingly disguised as the Assistant Planetship, in with a conspiratorial whisper to the Research Clerk.

dialogues.speaker: TERL, (AS ASSIST. PLANETSHIP)
dialogues.text: «.+-Can you keep a secret?

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCH CLERK
dialogues.text: I'd like to think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Assistant Planetship shakes his head, pointing to the ) who looks just like him on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: , That's not me! I never said that!

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: Oh shut up! We know it's you. You were stupid enough to sign your own name-- He holds up the sign-out sheet, bearing Terl's perfect fo the Assistant Planetship's signature. ON THE MONITOR... ~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl, in the guise of the Assistant Planetship, looks aro making sure no one's listening, before ‘confiding’...

dialogues.speaker: TERL, (AS ASSIST. PLANETSHIP)
dialogues.text: +..Why the hell should we put up with reduced pay and no vacations, all because our incompetent Planetship has no idea how to properly run this place?

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCH CLERK
dialogues.text: I don't think the fat-ass could run any planet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Research Clerk immediately turns to the Planetship, i

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCH CLERK
dialogues.text: I only said that, sir, to trick him into telling me the plan, s0 I could immediately come and warn you of it! The Planetship gives a gruff nod and continues to watch a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE RECORDING, Terl continues...

dialogues.speaker: TERL, (AS ASSIST. PLANETSHIP)
dialogues.text: All it would take is one strategically placed door-bomb and I'd be in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Assistant Planetship stands alone in front of a door Planetship's office. He nervously calls down the hall--

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: But what if there js a door-bomb? Terl, Ker and the Planetship watch from behind a protecti shield positioned a safe distance down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: I thought you said you didn't put one there! :

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: I didn't. But maybe someone else did!

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: If you refuse to cooperate with this investigation, I'm afraid regulaticns: would require me to vaporize you for the charge of high treason... The Assistant Planetship sighs. Then closes his eyes and his body, as if that could samehow protect him from an ex And he slowly cracks open the door. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: See, I told you I didn't put a-- A flash of light and a deafening blast as a CATACLYSMIC E blows the Assistant Planetship and much of the hall into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychlo workers hose down the last of the fire from the e Ker follows behind as the Planetship strolls by with Terl adamantly shaking his head, pretending to be distraught.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: But you can't take Ker! He's the best assistant I ever had-- y . " ¢ PLANETSEIP ~7You're out of your skull if you think I'm going to wait for Home Office to process a requisition for a new E-3 Level Executive Assistant!  a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl and Ker share a secret look of victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie sits alone in the corner, For the first time, he l defeated. He doesn't even bother to look up as... Terl cheerfully strides up, snaps a leash around Jonnie's and yanks him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: . TERL
dialogues.text: You've got a busy day ahead of you, rat-brain. You'll start with discs on mining techniques, core sampling, and machine operations. He dangles a handful of dead rats in front of Jonnie's fa TERL (cont'd) , Then after lunch, it's on to drilling : and flying simulators. Jonnie nods numbly. There's no more fight left in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker, in his new office, struggles through a crossword puz quickly hides it as the Planetship sticks his head into t

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: Quitting time. Want to get some food? Thanks, sir, but I'm going to stay and get some more work done. The Planetship nads, both surprised and impressed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And heading down the hall, the Planetship mutters to hims

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: +--Should have had my assistant vaporized a long time ago. He heads into an elevator and the doors close with a bing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as Ker hears the noise, he immediately steals int adjoining office-- INT. PLANETSHIP'S OFFICE —- CONTINUOUS And goes to work, snooping through the Planetship's perso

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie half-heartedly pushes buttons on control panel to HOLOGRAPHIC FIGHT SIMULATOR. But all he manages to do is. Crash into a simulated mountain.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: (growls) Crash one more time, and your little friend is no longer among the living. He holds up the REMOTE to Chrissy's explosive collar, the restarts the simulator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie is back to sitting alone with a despondent look. Carlo and Mickey slowly approach. Nothing is said for the longest time. And finally, Jonnie looks up at Carlo.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: You were right. I should have shot the monster when I had the chance... (quietly) That way, Sammy and Heywood would still be alive. :

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: You didn't kill them.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: No, the monster did. And I didn't kill the monster when I could have. (tortured whisper) Which means it's my fault.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: You didn't kill the monster for a reason. Jonnie gives him a haunted look--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: That's the point. If we try and fight them, more of us will end up getting killed. Maybe even everyone... (barely audible) All because of me. Carlo shakes his head, trying to hold back the anger.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
