dialogues.text: This isn't just about you. Remember what Heywood said. It's about all of us...

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: And we need you. You speak the monsters’ language. You know things about them. Jonnie looks around at the others in the cage, who are n at him. And he sees something on their faces he's never s before. Hope. The longest of beats, then...

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Everyone has to know. If we do this, there's a good chance that not one of us will be alive by the time it's over. But not one person is deterred. Carlo gives Jonnie's word to him--

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: Look around. This ain't exactly living. And even if we could escape and go back to our villages, we'd always be looking over our shoulder, waiting to be hunted down by the monsters. (pointed) And that ain't exactly living either.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: (fierce resolve) So if you can help us figure out a way to fight the monsters, no matter what it is, count us in.

dialogues.speaker: A VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Count us in too-- .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This voice belongs to one of the human slaves pressed aga bars of the next cage over, listening to what's going on Jonnie's cage. And from the next cage over from that...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What's going on? The human slave turns and calls to the second voice--

dialogues.speaker: HUMAN SLAVE
dialogues.text: Someone in that cage knows how to speak the monsters' language. And he's going to help us fight them-- Someone from the next cage asks what's going on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the news is met with the same ardent reaction. We PUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message passing from cage to cage, until the whole zo &@ DEAFENING ROAR. The battle-cry resounding defiantly in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a whole different Jonnie. Attentive and focused as h fingers fly over the similator's control panel. Terl watches, impressed. Then holds up the remote to Chri explosive collar, gloating...

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Never underestimate what a little leverage can do, rat-brain. Jonnie nods, letting Terl believe what he wants to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in Jonnie's cage crowds around him as he draws l in the dirt, teaching the others to read and write. Jonni passes the stick to Carlo, who carefully starts to write of his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Planetship strolls into his office, but freezes in hi What the hell are Terl and Ker ‘doing in his inner-sanctu But then he sees the files all neatly laid out on his des looks at them, the life draining from his eyes. TERL . Isn't it interesting you've been keeping two sets of books... And while you've told the workers that this planet's operating at a loss, it's actually quite profitable. The Planetship shakes his head, feebly trying to explain.

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: I only claimed it's running at a loss to try and motivate everyone to work harder.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Of course you did... (knowing smile) And it had nothing to do with how it allows you to cut everyone's pay, so you keep all the extra credits for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: Oh, that? I can explain that-- But Terl drops a heavy tome onto the desk with a resoundi

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: --I'm afraid company regulations requires me to vaporize you.  TERL (cont'd) But I can see how someone in your position, faced with growing old and no future, might be forced to find creative ways to solve your financial problems.

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: «+-You can?

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: And it's not in any of our interests for you to stop being the Planetship... But it may be prudent for you to start sharing some of your authority. Ker hands the Planetship a huge sheaf of requisition and forms, along with a pen to sign then.

dialogues.speaker: PLANETSHIP
dialogues.text: But these forms are blank. And undated. (shakes his head) If I sign them, you could put anything you want on them. You'd be running the entire planet! I'd be nothing but a puppet--

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: --If you don’t want to do it this way, we could always do it by the book. He pats his Blast-Gun, underscoring the threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SUPPLY CLERK stares incredulously at a requisition form

dialogues.speaker: SUPPLY CLERK
dialogues.text: What the hell does the Planetship need with all this mining equipment?!

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: That's not even the crazy part. (holds up an order form) He's ordered me to take a group of man- animals with the equipment out to a remote area to see if they can be trained to mine. Can you imagine that?!

dialogues.speaker: SUPPLY CLERK
dialogues.text: Man-animals being able to mine?! The old Psychlo's gone completely insane.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. But what can I do... (helpless shrug) An order's an order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOWLING WIND cuts through a large steel cage containing Mickey, and some twenty other men, along with an assortme mining machines and equipment. The cage is suspended from underbelly of a--

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHLO CARGO-TYPE AIRCRAFT
dialogues.text: Which hurtles over the majestic Rocky Mountains. Followin behind, Ker is at the helm of a smaller fighter-plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl keeps a careful eye on Jonnie, who is piloting the a An ALARM suddenly blares through-out the cockpit--

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATED VOICE
dialogues.text: Warning! External sensors indicate : dangerous radiation levels ahead-- Blue sparks are starting to pop throughout the cockpit. For the first time, there is genuine fear in Terl's eyes. immediately points to a meadow visible below-- TERL . What are you waiting for?! Land the . damn craft. This is as far as I can go. Jonnie punches buttons on the control panel, landing the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl motions Jonnie to the cargo c a the meadow neasbes go cage as Ker lands the fighter in

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Meet me back here in fourteen days with at least half of that cage full of gold, or I'll ‘terminate’ your entire operation. As the threat hangs there, Terl checks his time-piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men have been assembled out on the meadow, when there ethereal, almost otherworldly WAILING from above as--

dialogues.speaker: A PSYCHLO RECON DRONE
dialogues.text: Hurtles overhead. One of the drone's high-tech CAMERA-LEN rotates to stare down at our guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRANSMISSION RECEIVER spits out a SURVEILLANCE PHOTO ta the recon drone, depicting Jonnie and the others staring the sky. Ker hands it to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl, who gives the surveillance photo to Jonnie. I

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Tell them that even though I won't be at the mining site, I'll be able to keep an eye on you... (admonishes) And anyone who isn't working hard will be ‘replaced', if you know what I mean. He pats his blast-gun, making sure Jonnie understands, th and climbs into the fighter as Ker pilots it up and away. Jonnie and the men start back to the cargo aircraft, but instantly whirls. Eyes scanning the underbrush in the tre He grabs a PICK-AX from the mining equipment, holding it weapon. Following his lead, the rest of the men do likewi The bush moves. And out from behind it steps-- A wild-eyed figure with the look of someone who has survi long time alone in the wilderness. Ignoring the ‘array -o pointed at him, the ROGUE stares at Jonnie in complete aw

dialogues.speaker: ROGUE
dialogues.text: How'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: +.-Do what?

dialogues.speaker: ROGUE
dialogues.text: Make that monster go away without killing you. Jonnie gives him a friendly smile.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it's a long story.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: And .sorry, pal, we'd love to fill you in, but we don't have a lot of time-- The rogue sizes up Jonnie and the rest of the men, then n he's reached some important decision, and returns Jonnie'

dialogues.speaker: ROGUE
dialogues.text: The name's Mason, and I've got nothing but time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cargo aircraft lands on top of the shopping mall wher and Carlo were first captured by the Psychlo wrangler. Jonnie and a small group of men emerge and race inside th Jonnie and a group of his men move through the store, sca WALKIE-TALKIES and RECHARGEABLE. BATTERIES, while-- . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i i ini i id our guys Jonnie lands the cargo-aircraft at the mining site, an now including MASON, begin hauling the equipment into the of a cave. Carlo looks up from the list he's been studying with a wo expression--

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: If we work around the clock, we'll be lucky to mine enough gold to fill half ' that cage... There's no way we're going to be able to do that and get all this stuff done we need for the revolt.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: I've sot worse news. There's only gonna be about half of you digging. (off their looks) I'm gonna be looking somewhere else for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey and Sammy lead_a separate team through a gun shop, collecting weapons, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlo and a third squad scrounge up supplies, including S THIN WIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie shows his group basic engine mechanics as he rebui motor on a small, gas-powered generator. Nearby... Mickey and Sammy's team assemble crude, but effective-loo homemade bombs from the mining equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the generator, now reassembled, Jonnie fires it to l The men burst out in applause as electricity flows to a l battery rechargers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie pilots the aircraft. Carlo is in the navigator's s Behind him, Mickey shakes his head--

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: ..-Hey, what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gonnie banks the aircraft around. And now, staring at the through the cockpit window is...

dialogues.speaker: THE STATUE OF LIBERTY
dialogues.text: Watching over a completely empty harbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same with the city of Manhattan. The entire island is literal ghost town. Nothing moves. Hovering overhead--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: : Jonnie studies the map, realizing.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: We're here. Over New York. a EXT. MINING SITE -- CONTINUOUS - A wailing sound grows louder as the RECON DRONE passes ov cameras spying down on the mining site, where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden from view in the cave, two of Jonnie's men have st behind and now pull on a series of thin wires, which run a pulley system and out to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty DEPARTMENT STORE MANNEQUINS, all decked out in min and holding shovels and pick-axes. As the wires are pulle The mannequins move like marionettes, looking like they'r at work mining the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl grabs the surveillance photo as soon as it spits out the transmission receiver. He gives a satisfied nod.
- That's what a little leverage can do for you. See them all slaving away.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: Well, with my share, I'm going to fire all my wives and buy new ones. Maybe even a pretty one... What about you?

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Bribe my way off this god-forsaken planet and get assigned a real position that's worthy of my talents and training.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That has got to be the stupidest thing Ker has ever heard

dialogues.speaker: ' KER
dialogues.text: } You're going through all this trouble, , just so you can get a job!

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Not a job... Respect. The fierce desire is palpable in his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cargo aircraft. is parked next to the Library of Cong

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Books on uranium are spread across a table as Jonnie unfo . . . RADIOACTIVE-SITE Map of the United States. .He trac a! to’a mountain in Colorado which bears the radiation sy ' triangle inside a circle... JONNIE . Here's where we're supposed to be mining the monster's gold. That symbol means ~ radiation. Which is caused by uranium. He moves his finger to an area in New Mexico. JONNIE (cont'd) And here's where my tribe is located.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: «--It has the same symbol.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: (looks up at them) Do you guys know the names of the places where you're from?

dialogues.speaker: . MICKEY
dialogues.text: A village called Los Alamos...

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: An island in what used to be the country of Pennsylvania...

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Which island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Mile Island. Jonnie finds Los Alamos and Three Mile Island on the map. gure enough, they both have the radiation symbol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlo and Mickey don't understand. Jonnie explains...

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: From what I've been able to figure out, many years ago, the monsters attacked our planet with a deadly gas. Almost everyone died, except a few who made it into underground shelters. When the air cleared, these people came out, but were then hunted down by the monsters. points to the map) Only a few mist have made it to the safety of these remote areas with radiation where the Psychlos couldn't go. ' And we're descendants of those people. Mickey nods, realizing this is good news.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: So even if we fail to take over the planet, our people will be safe as long as they stay in areas with this radiation thing? .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wn , They'd be safe from the monsters. — ' . (the bad news) But radiation isn't good for humans, either. That's why a lot of people in our villages get sick and don't live as long as they should. He stares at them, making sure they understand. JONNIE (cont'd) So if we don't take back our planet, our people can't leave these areas or they'll be hunted down. But if they stay in these areas, over time, more and more of them will get sick and die... . (the grim reality) Either way, the last of humanity will slowly but steadily become extinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aircraft lands next to FORT KNOX. Our guys emerge, ca large Psychlo equipment cases, and head into the building

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: If gold's so valuable to them, how come - - the monsters haven't already taken it out of here? :

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: From what I read in the library, the gold here is stored in lead-lined vaults to protect it from the radiation in case of a nuclear war... (beat) And that lead would keep the monsters from detecting the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys stand in front of an imposing vault.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO 70
dialogues.text: -..You sure we're going to be able t get through this? Jonnie and Mickey fire-up a Psychlo LASER-DRILL.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: One thing you got to give those monsters, their mining equipment is highly effective. “ghey attack the vault with the high-tech drill. It cuts through, like a hot knife through butter. As the screaming bit, is pulled smoking from the hole, a light streams out. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie and the others descend over the mine area. But it looks very different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are looks’ of concern on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Looks like an avalanche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light shines down from the present edge and confirms it The fissure, thirty feet back from the old edge, had simp _ opened and fallen into the gorge. Jonnie races back to the hundred feet deep shaft edge. He looks around, flashing his light. . Jonnie approaches the hole more closely. Until he sees th slide marks of the cross timbers that had supported the h cage over the hole.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: A light shines down from the present edge and confirms it The fissure, thirty feet back from the old edge, had simp opened and fallen into the gorge. Jonnie races back to the hundred feet deep shaft edge. He looks around, flashing his light.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Avalanche. Jonnie approaches the hole more closely. Until he sees th slide marks of the cross timbers that had supported the h cage over the hole.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The place is broadly lit now with lamps the relief crew h put on poles. Carlo and the others pay out the line of a bucket rigged to crane cable... -+.Jonnie and three others are lowered to the bottom of t hole. They swing picks at the rocks, filling buckets that are instantly shot aloft to be replaced by empty ones. LATER. - . The crew has been changed. Twice. But Jonnie is still dow there. They work in a blur of speed. Another crew arrives. Jonnie stays. Finally, he hears a distant whisper of sound. He holds up hand for silence.

dialogues.speaker: . VOICE
dialogues.text: (very faintly) ..e-air hole... Jonnie grabs a LONG MINE DRILL. He socks the rock drill p into it, and signals the man on the drill motor. They ‘buck the drill into it with the pressure handles. A with a high scream the drill goes through.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Air hose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEE OE SRE IS i i a St en nn ne I I

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The place is broadly lit now with lamps the relief crew h put on poles. Carlo and the others pay out the line of a bucket rigged to crane cable... ..-Jonnie and three others are lowered to the bottom of t hole. They swing picks at the rocks, filling buckets that are instantly shot aloft to be replaced by empty ones.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The crew has been changed. Twice. But Jonnie is still dow there. They work in a blur of speed. Another crew arrives. Jonnie stays. Finally, he hears a distant whisper of sound. He holds up hand for silence.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (very faintly) +.eair hole... Jonnie grabs a LONG MINE DRILL. He socks the rock drill p into it, and signals the man on the drill motor. They buck the drill into it with the pressure ‘handles An with a high scream the drill goes through.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Air hose! They feed the hose through the drill hole and turn the ai compressor on. Air from the drift squeals back past the s of the hose and into the rescue crew's faces.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: They have managed to clear the top of the rockfall and dr men out. Passing them to the top, silently in the hoist buckets. A dust- and sweat-covered Jonnie is the last one up. The salvages crew are bundled up, sitting in the snow, mo of them drinking something hot.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: We lost the lode.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: That's alright. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie yanks the cover from the stacks of gold bars, harvested at Fort Knox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie stands next to a cargo cage half-full of GOLD BARS waits for Terl to land his aircraft and climb out. Terl is impressed, but also instantly suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Why is it in bars?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: We figured someone of your stature wouldn't want something as coarse as raw ore. Terl doesn't look convinced until he runs a hand-held COM ANALYZER over the gold. It checks out as the real thing. Hiding his glee, Terl turns back and growls at Jonnie--

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: I obviously need to adjust the schedule. Since you rat-brains had enough extra time to smelt the gold into bricks, I will now expect the rest of the gold in seven days. Not bothering to wait for a response, Terl loads the glor gold into his aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie and the rest of the men have reassembled back at t

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: So, if we don't give him the rest of the gold in seven days, he'll kill us. But if we do give him the gold...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: +.-He no longer needs us.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: Which means he'll kill us. But Jonnie doesn't look the least bit concerned.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: All this means is that our deadline's been moved up a bit. We now have seven days to take back our planet. The group nods, trying to match Jonnie's confidence as Jo gets down to business, opening a MAP of Denver. He points ZOO in the middle of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the monster's Field Manual, even a large-scale escape of human slaves from the zoo would only constitute a stage-one alarm.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: To the monsters, it'd be like a bunch of horses escaping. No one seems too happy about the comparison. But Jonnie n

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Because the monsters only see us as harmless animals, they won't be wearing battle-gear when they come to round us up... ' (a gleam in his eye) Which means they won't have on their breath-masks Mickey excitedly jumps in again, beating Jonnie to the pu MICKEY . And any monsters outside a building without a breath-mask won't be able to breath once Carlo blows up the dome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes spin to Carlo, who gives a confident thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: Piece-of-cake!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: «What about the monsters that are inside the buildings when the dome blows?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: They'll survive. And we can expect them to come at us in a second assault. But that's where you guys come in... His eyes sweep the group as he explains... JONNIE (cont'd) Everyone's going to train how to use the monster's weapons. Then we'll sneak you in to blend in with the rest of the people who escaped from the zoo... (beat) So when Carlo takes out the first wave of monsters, you guys'l1 jump out and grab their weapons, then set-up an ambush for the second wave of monsters who will be wearing breath-masks.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: Plus, I'll be flying overhead, raining explosives down on the bastards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excitement spreads through the group. The plan actually h chance of working. But then Jonnie adds...

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: But everyone needs to understand. The moment we blow the dame, or fight back in anyway, this becomes a stage-two alarm.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: And that's the one thing we can't let happen, right?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Right. A stage-two alarm means the monsters alert their Home Planet. And moments later, thousands of troops and gas drones will be teleported here. (levels with them) There's no way we could fight that. We'd all be dead within seconds. The group's excitement instantly turns to confusion.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: «».Then what the hell's the point of killing all the monsters on this planet, - if we're all going to get wiped out?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Because before this thing gets to a stage-two alarm... (matter-of-fact) We're going to destroy their Home Planet. Everyone stares at him. He must be joking. But he isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie and a handful of men emerge from a Strategic Weapo carrying out crates of conventional explosives, as well a A Cruise-Missile NUCLEAR WARHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey restlessly pokes around, exploring the classroom a and Carlo huddle over a tech-manual. The nuclear warhead sits on a table in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: According to this, we have to make-sure -the firing-mechanism is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Hey, look at these guys! Something must be wrong with their heads. In the back of the room, Mickey points to an old PHOTO of a BATTALION OF CADETS, all with their hands to their fore

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Nothing's wrong. They're saluting. It's a sign of respect. He salutes, showing Mickey, then gets back to the busines hand, continuing to read from the manual-- JONNIE (cont'd) ..eMake-sure the firing-mechanism is properly in place and operational. Jonnie and Carlo both take deep breaths, then pick up too gingerly go to work on the warhead--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl rips the lid off of a coffin and yanks out the dead damping the corpse to the ground and kicking it out of hi He repeats the process with another coffin, uriceremoniou flinging the corpse to the ground, then fires up a LASER and blasts away, carving FALSE BOTTOMS into'the caskets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the nuclear warhead now partially dismantled, Jonnie Carlo carefully remove a lead plate with surgical precisi

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: (re: the manual) «-.No matter what, we can't touch the auto-sensor.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO
dialogues.text: What's the auto-sensor look like?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: The illustrations are in Appendix-A (before Carlo can ask) We couldn't find Appendix-A.

dialogues.speaker: . CARLO
dialogues.text: And if we touch this auto-sensor?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: The bomb will detonate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still whistling his war song, Terl begins filling the fal bottoms in the coffins with his beloved gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone congregates around the map of Denver one last ti Jonnie finalizes the battle plan...

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Once the prisoners escape from the zoo, Chrissy will lead them here to the Civic Center Park... That's where you guys will be waiting to blend in with them... And | when the guards are sent to round all of you up, it should leave minimal resistance here at the teleportation platform-- He points to a section of the city away from the park. JONNIE (cont'd) Which is when we'll move in and secure the platform, and teleport the nuclear weapon up to their planet. Mason points to the nuclear warhead.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: -..And you're sure that thing will be enough to take-out their entire planet?

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Radiation explodes their breath gas. Which is exactly the same as their planet's atmosphere... Mickey slowly raises his head. A darkness in his voice.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: With all respect, sir, I'd like to be the one who goes up and detonates the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: It's brave of you to offer. But it's my plan, so I go--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --You don't understand. I want to go. (determined) So, I can see my brother again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie stares at Mickey, his heart breaking. But this tim Jonnie has no choice. He has to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: There's no point in you going. No human can breath on their planet. Plus, the gravity is too strong. I'm sorry. (soft) But your brother was dead within moments of being there. ' Mickey returns Jonnie's look without blinking.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: I know. : That's why I want to go. (quietly) So, I can be with him again. A long beat. Then Jonnie finally nods, giving Mickey his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker comes strolling out of the bar, when a figure suddenl out of the shadows in front of him.. It's JONNIE--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: There's no way Terl's going to share any of the gold with you.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about? And what. are you even doing here, you're supposed to be mining--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: --Think about it. Terl went through all that effort to trick you, so he could record you into laying out the plan. It was more than just making you the patsy. (beat) Terl got leverage on you so he wouldn't have to share the gold.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: How the blast do you know about the recording?!

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: - | It sure is interesting some of the discs one can find in Terl's personal vault. Ker's eyes light-up at his sudden good fortune. He pulls blast-gun and orders--

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: Give the disc to me!

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I don't have it with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jonnie leads Ker to the cage, Chrissy holds up the DIS

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: Tell her to give it to me--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: --I'm afraid we can't just give it to you. But you can trade for it. Ker, chuckling at Jonnie's stupidity, re-pulls his Blast-

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: I don't think so, crap-brain! Because if you don't give me the disc, I‘'ll-- At Jonnie's signal--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISSY immediately hands the disc to someone in her cage turns hands it off to another person, this continues unti The disc reaches someone at the edge of the cage, who pit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker tries to point his gun at the humans in warning, but process is repeated too fast for him to follow as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A human chain moves the disc from hand to hand, cage to c before Ker knows it, the disc disappears from view around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker turns back to Jonnie with a friendly smile.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: .--What kind of trade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ker uses a special tool to remove the explosive collar fr Chrissy's neck, then trades the collar for the disc.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Bow about we make another trade. (motions to the zoo cage KEY) As a male member of your species, you can understand why I would want to come and 'visit' with her-- .

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: --Forget it, crap-head! You just keep your mind on getting the rest of the gold!

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Too bad... (holds up a SECOND DISC) Because the gold is almost ready and I thought you might want some incriminating evidence on your friend, Terl. Ker doesn't have to think about it. He immediately trades zoo key for the second disc. As soon as Ker is gone... . ‘ Chrissy gives Jonnie a confused look.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISSY
dialogues.text: Won't the monster in charge be able to see I'm no longer wearing the collar.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: (hands her the key) After tonight, it won't matter much either way. There's an unspoken tension between them. The first time alone since he left their village. Chrissy tries to cover

dialogues.speaker: CHRISSY
dialogues.text: I know you don't believe in fate, but I've always known you were destined to do something great...

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: «.-We're going to do something great. All of us, together. -She nods, but there's still something not being said. Th of beats. And finally, Jonnie struggles to find the right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . JONNIE (cont'd) And we need to do this not only for our own freedom, but for the possibility of a life for the children. Chrissy looks at him and starts to ask something, but doe He returns her look, clarifying... JONNIE (cont'd) A life for our children. (quickly adds) Of course, only if you'd be willing to take an ‘arrogant greener’ as your husband.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISSY
dialogues.text: I don't know... (warm smile) I think I could live with that. They embrace. Each of them knowing it might be the last t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl-comes strolling into the office, but suddenly stops tracks. EVERY MONITOR in the room is playing a recording TERL (ON THE MONITORS ). ...We'd have to use explosives. Home Office would detect them and send down a survey team, which means we wouldn't be able to keep the gold for ourselves. Ker smugly pauses the disc, FREEZING the guilty evidence.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: I've been thinking. Eighty-twenty is a pretty fair distribution of the gold... (loving every moment of this) But J should get the eighty per cent. Terl stares at him. And without hesitation:

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Congratulations! I knew there was a true Psychlo in you somewhere! Ker remains on guard. He's not about to fall for any trap But Terl seems genuinely happy, if not downright ecstatic TERL (cont'd) You finally figured out how to get proper leverage on someone. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERL (cont'd) Which means I haven't wasted my time trying to train you! Ker can't believe it. This is going much better than he t

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: You're not upset?

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Don't be crazy! You don't know how long I've been waiting for this day. And I know just the perfect way to celebrate-- He pulls his Blast-Gun and slides it into kill position--

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! You can't kill me! (explains) . I made a copy of your disc and gave it to someone for safe keeping. And if anything happens to me, they'll turn it into the authorities. A frozen beat. Then Terl has to lower the gun with a sigh KER (cont'd) - It's your own fault, sir. (good-natured) You were just too good of a teacher.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: And how about giving the old teacher a clue as to who this person might be?

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: You insult yourself, sir. You taught me better than to fall for that one.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Well, then how the hell am I supposed to know who it is. I mean, it could be anyone on this damn planet... It could be one of the mechanics. It could be a concubine. It could be someone in the communications office. Hell, it could even be... Terl opens his desk drawer and calmly pulls out--

dialogues.speaker: THE BARTENDER'S SEVERED HEAD
dialogues.text: TERL (cont'd) Our friendly bartender! Ker's face immediately goes death-white. Terl tosses the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERL (cont'd) You know, you really should chose your friends a bit more carefully... Ker looks from the head to the desk drawer to Terl, reali Terl had this planned all along. His body slumps in defea Terl raises his blast gun.

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: Don't shoot! You win! I'll go back to being the patsy! He fumbles a disc out of his pocket and hands it to Terl. KER (cont'd) See? That's the disc of me laying out the plan. You can have it back. Which means I'm back to being the patsy. And you can't kill the patsy, right?!

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Here's your final exam. Try real hard to pass it... When committing a crime, how many patsies does one need? As Ker chews on this, Terl reminds him-- . TERL (cont'd) And while you're thinking, remember all the hard work we put into getting leverage on the Planetship. A process, I might add, that you were quite resourceful in helping with. The life drains from Ker as...

dialogues.speaker: KER
dialogues.text: The Planetship ordered us to train the man-animals to mine the gold. So, if anyone found out, he'd be responsible. (practically crying) And you only need one patsy.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Very impressive. You pass the exam with highest marks. KABLAM! Terl shoots a fist-sized hole through Ker's face. TERL (cont'd) But I'm afraid you failed the course. Ker is dead long before he hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of sentries make their usual nightly rounds, when hear a strange noise. Turning, they catch a glimpse of-- ‘A LONE HUMAN SLAVE Racing away up a path and disappearing around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: How the hell did that one get out... The other guard shrugs, unconcerned. After all, man-anima that fast. So they calmly walk-jog after the escapee--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the escapee now in tow, the guards head back to the One of them shakes his head in amusement--

dialogues.speaker: ZOO GUARD
dialogues.text: Not only are these man-animals slow, but they've got to be the stupidest things. (jeering laugh) . It didn't even have the sense to hide. It just stood there, letting us-- | : The words freeze in his throat as they turn a bend and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every single cage is empty. Not a human in sight. The onl the eerie creaking of open cage doors swaying gently ~in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLAXON HORNS crank-up, wailing into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERL finishes loading the coffins full of his precious go a cart as he barks into his radio--

dialogues.speaker: TERL, (INTO RADIO)

(point to several of the guards) All non-essential personnel are to go over and help with the round-up. The selected guards grumble about having to go, and...

dialogues.text: Okay, But Don't Make It Too Long! I've Got Company Up Here-- EXT. TELEPORTATION FIELD —- CONTINUOUS The three Psychlo Guards run from cover to cover, working way to set-up a cross-fire on Jonnie. From one of their r

dialogues.text: Hearing this, the two Psychlos immediately charge the bun

dialogues.text: Jonnie desperately searches for another weapon. But all h is his knife. Which won't do much good against... The two Psychlos storming into the bunker, turning their guns on him at point-blank-range--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: That's right... Which should make it obvious that I've been trained as part of a secret high-level operation... The two Psychlos exchange a look, then pull their radios. JONNIE (cont'd) Although, before you radio your superiors, maybe there is one other thing you should be more concerned about.

dialogues.speaker: A PSYCHLO
dialogues.text: And what the hell is that-- KABLAM!! One Psychlo goes down in a‘bloody heap as-- . Jonnie has stalled them long enough for MICKEY to sneak d position. The remaining Psychlo turns his gun on the youn But Jonnie jumps the Psychlo from behind, slashing its th with his hunting knife.

dialogues.text: Jonnie and Mickey load the NUCLEAR WARHEAD onto the platf

dialogues.text: The drumming of the generators reverberates through the a the automated voice finishes the countdown to teleportati

dialogues.text: In two... In one... (a buzzing sound) Teleportation Sequence Canceled. And before Jonnie can react-- TERL presses a Blast-Gun against the side of his head.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Hope I'm not interrupting anything. An eerie stillness as the generator-dynamos slowly fall s

dialogues.text: The Psychlos on the dome have already disarmed one set of explosives surrounding the apex, and are removing another

dialogues.text: Keeping his gun trained on Jonnie and Mickey, Terl keys h

dialogues.text: This is Security Chief, Terl. I've personally taken care of the situation at the teleportation field. There is no need to send additional guards

dialogues.speaker: TERL, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Negative. Our boys have been working: hard and deserve a little fun.. Tell them to set their weapons to kill position and happy-hunting. (grins) Exterminate all the man-animals at will. Jonnie returns the stare in helpless anguish ‘as--

dialogues.text: A collective roar of enthusiasm goes up from the Psychlos orders are relayed. They toss down their nets and ropes a their blasters, setting them into KILL-POSITION, then-- Eire_on the unarmed humans. Chrissy urgently pulls her ra

dialogues.text: ~-Hold On, I'm taking It Out!

dialogues.text: Chrissy's the one who comes up with it, blasting a hole t the monsters chest, then spins, firing on another Psychlo One of, Jonnie's trained men springs forward out of the c the weapon from the fallen Psychlos, then joins Chrissy i The other Psychlos, who realizing they're under attack, a return fire, catching the rebel fighter in a cross-fire, to shreds. The Psychlos then turn their weapons on Chriss

She's back against a side of the building, trapped as the Psych move in for the kill, firing relentlessly at her, when fr A sky-full of snowflake-sized pieces of glass rain down, shimmering like ethereal spirits dancing in the night air But as beautiful as it is, the result is deadly to the Ps Without breath-masks, they drop to the ground, convulsing

dialogues.text: In contrast to TERL, who calmly pulls a breath-mask from As he secures the mask, he explains to Jonnie with a smir

dialogues.text: rerl keeps his gun trained on Jonnie and Mickey, while ca keying his radio--

dialogues.text: Uplink a red-alert to Home Planet. (matter-of-fact) It's time we eradicate these pitiful man-animals once and for all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Terl finishes loading his gold onto the Platform, then \ gun on Jonnie...

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Even though you're just a rat-brain, I must admit you gave me quite a sporting challenge. And you'll make a hell of an interesting conversation piece once you're stuffed and hanging on the wall at the Academy Alumni Club. With the weapon trained on Jonnie, Terl backs up to the c bunker. Mickey can't keep the panic from his voice.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?! He sent the red-alert--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: --We! re going to let him start-up the teleportation sequence... (fierce resolve) Then no matter what happens to me, just make sure you and the nuclear weapon are on the platform. EXT. CONTROL BUNKER —~ CONTINUOUS The high-pitched HUM of the generators start to fill the

dialogues.text: Teleportation Sequence Initiated. (a i ) Teleportation in twenty...

dialogues.text: Jonnie charges off the platform. Terl spins and FIRES at But Jonnie manages to dive clear of the shot, then pivots blurring speed and throws his--

dialogues.speaker: HUNTING KNIFE
dialogues.text: Through the air, sending it straight at--

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Who tries to twist out of the way, but the knife slams de his shoulder. Terl pulls it out as--

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Launches himself like a possessed demon straight into him Fueled by primal rage, Jonnie is able to Jock the’ much-b Psychlo to the ground, jarring the gun from Terl's grip. But Terl is bigger and stronger. He pins Jonnie down and savagely tears into him with his razor-like claws-- Jonnie lunges up and grabs Terl's wounded shoulder with b hands. Squeezing and twisting as hard as he can, Jonnie w Terl off of him. But the victory is short lived as... Terl rolls over and is now able to get back onto his feet But. Jonnie hangs on. and stays focused on the monster's Digging one hand into Terl's wounded shoulder, while PUMM it in a mad blur with the other, inflicting what damage h Hissing in pain, Terl swats Jonnie back to the ground the his blast-gun and stands, towering over-- Jonnie, who can see behind Terl, where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey struggles with all his might, just managing to boo nuclear warhead back onto the platform.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATED VOICE, (FROM CONSOLE)
dialogues.text: Teleportation in twelve... In eleven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie locks eyes with Terl, trying to keep him from noti Mickey scrambling onto the platform with the nuclear weap

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Look, I know you're going to kill me. But I have one last request. Terl aims the gun straight down between Jonnie's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you're in no position to be making requests—

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: --I know. But I'm begging you. (pleads) With the gas drones coming, is there any way to spare one human life... Because you were right about the young lady you put the collar on. I do know her. (quietly) She was to be my wife. Terl can't believe Jonnie's stupidity. Chuckles with glee TERL . Thanks for reminding me, rat-brain. (pulls the REMOTE to Chrissy's collar) Before you die, you should have the pleasure of knowing what happens to your little "wife" to be. Terl raises the remote with one paw, the other pointing t blast-gun down at Jonnie, who stares him straight in the

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Trust me. You don't want to do that--

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: Trust me. I want nothing more-- Terl plunges the remote's button. Obviously not realizing When Jonnie grabbed his shoulder, he had clasped the expl collar from Chrissy under one of the gold epaulettes and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + Blood gushing from his shoulder where it used to be connected to an arm. Terl is too stunned to react as-- Jonnie dives to the ground, grabbing the blaster-gun stil connected to what's left of Terl's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The humming of the generators grows louder.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATED VOICE, (FROM CONSOLE)
dialogues.text: In five... In four... In three... EXT. TELEPORTATION FIELD -—- CONTINUOUS Keeping the blast-gun on Terl, Jonnie turns to check on--

dialogues.text: Mickey pulls out the nuclear detonator. A sense of deep p the mission he's about to perform. As the countdown finis Mickey turns and gives his friend Jonnie a SALUTE. EXT. TELEPORTATION FIELD -- CONTINUOUS. Jonnie salutes Mickey back with eyes full of respect. The suddenly rocked by a DEAFENING ROAR and BLINDING LIGHT, a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the GAS DRONES and shock troops all loaded for earth countdown for teleportation is at...

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATED VOICE, (FROM CONSOLE)
dialogues.text: Teleportation in five... In four... At the far end of a seemingly endless row of platforms--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICKEY appears, along with Terl's coffins and the nuclear The Psychlo workers in the vicinity laugh at Mickey's fat Mickey stares at them without blinking--

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: I know I'm going to die... The Psychlos obviously don't speak English and have no id he's saying. But they crowd around in morbid curiosity as The planet's overwhelming gravity crushes Mickey to the g The young twin's eyes bulging, he announces to the crowd- MICKEY (cont'd) But so are you-- This cracks up the others. With his final moment of life, Mickey pushes the detonator button... :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the countdown to earth's destruction finishes--

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATED VOICE, (FROM CONSOLE)
dialogues.text: In two... In one-- KKKAAABBBBBLLLLLAAAAAAAMMMMMMMI III ELL Pil The GAS DRONES and SHOCK TROOPS vaporized into oblivion-- Along. with everything else in the path of the mushroom c slamming through the city like a tidal wave. of pure dest Blasting apart countless Psychlos and their buildings. An the initial blast subsides, the radiation reacts with the Causing the AIR TO EXPLODE in an instantaneous chain-reac spreading out faster than the eye can see, as... The atmosphere is literally burnt away from the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blinding white flame expanding out until it surrounds t mammoth planet.- Burning with searing intensity until--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aircraft lands at the fort, and Jonnie and Chrissy eme Mason, sporting a finely-crafted wooden leg, steps up to

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: We're all but done here. The painters just finished yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonnie nods as they head into the fort.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Good. Because now that we've got everyone out of the contaminated areas, we're going to need your help organizing a summit with the clan leaders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason leads Jonnie and Chrissy down a long armored hallwa through a thick vault door, to where--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terl, a stump where his arm used to be, downs a shot of k in his new ‘living quarters', which have been painted pur him. He stares at Jonnie through the steel bars.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: What kind of barbaric species are you rat-brains? Either put me to work as a slave or have the decency to vaporize me. (with revulsion) But to imprison me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Oh, we'll put you to work, don't worry. ° (explains) You told me yourself, Earth isn't the only planet that you Psychlos colonized.

dialogues.speaker: CBRISSY
dialogues.text: .--And those other Psychlos out there probably aren't too pleased about what _ happened to their Home Planet. Terl stares at her in amazement, then eyes Jonnie.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: She speaks Psychlo.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISSY
dialogues.text: We all do...

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: We figure it might come in handy if those other Psychlos ever decide to come by for a little ‘visit.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: One could only hope.

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: Which make you useful to us. After all, you did graduate top of your class.

dialogues.speaker: CBRISSY
dialogues.text: So you must have some understanding of Psychlo battle tactics and strategy.

dialogues.speaker: TERL
dialogues.text: (snide laugh) And why the hell would I ever help you?!

dialogues.speaker: JONNIE
dialogues.text: I'm just guessing that you wouldn't want . the other Psychlos to know that it was your greed and corruption that allowed us to destroy their home planet. Terl stops laughing. His eyes narrowing into slits as Jon holds up a DISC. SJONNIE (cont'd) I may be a rat-brain, but I was smart enough to figure out how to make a copy of this before I gave it to Ker. On Terl's look of complete and utter defeat, we...
